verses.kjv: And Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to Beersheba, and offered sacrifices unto the God of his father Isaac.
verses.ct: Israel set out on his journey, bringing everything he owned. When he reached Beersheba, he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

verses.kjv: And God spake unto Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob. And he said, Here am I.
verses.ct: During the night, God spoke to Israel through a vision, saying, "Jacob, Jacob." He replied, "Here I am."

verses.kjv: And he said, I am God, the God of thy father: fear not to go down into Egypt; for I will there make of thee a great nation:
verses.ct: God said, "I am God, the God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, because I will make you into a great nation there."

verses.kjv: I will go down with thee into Egypt; and I will also surely bring thee up again: and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes.
verses.ct: "I will go down to Egypt with you, and I will certainly bring you back up again. Joseph's own hand will close your eyes."

verses.kjv: And Jacob rose up from Beersheba: and the sons of Israel carried Jacob their father, and their little ones, and their wives, in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.
verses.ct: Then Jacob left Beersheba. His sons transported their father Jacob, along with their children and wives, in the wagons that Pharaoh had provided for the journey.

verses.kjv: And they took their cattle, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt, Jacob, and all his seed with him:
verses.ct: They brought their livestock and all the possessions they had acquired in Canaan. Jacob and all his descendants traveled to Egypt.

verses.kjv: His sons, and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters, and his sons’ daughters, and all his seed brought he with him into Egypt.
verses.ct: He brought with him to Egypt his sons and grandsons, his daughters and granddaughters—every one of his descendants.

verses.kjv: And these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt, Jacob and his sons: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn.
verses.ct: These are the names of Israel's descendants who went to Egypt—Jacob and his sons: Reuben was Jacob's firstborn.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Reuben; Hanoch, and Phallu, and Hezron, and Carmi.
verses.ct: Reuben's sons were Hanoch, Phallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman.
verses.ct: Simeon's sons were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, who was the son of a Canaanite woman.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Levi; Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.ct: Levi's sons were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah, and Pharez, and Zarah: but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And the sons of Pharez were Hezron and Hamul.
verses.ct: Judah's sons were Er, Onan, Shelah, Pharez, and Zarah. However, Er and Onan had died in Canaan. Pharez's sons were Hezron and Hamul.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Issachar; Tola, and Phuvah, and Job, and Shimron.
verses.ct: Issachar's sons were Tola, Phuvah, Job, and Shimron.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Zebulun; Sered, and Elon, and Jahleel.
verses.ct: Zebulun's sons were Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

verses.kjv: These be the sons of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob in Padanaram, with his daughter Dinah: all the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty and three.
verses.ct: These were the sons Leah bore to Jacob in Padanaram, along with his daughter Dinah. The total number of souls among his sons and daughters was thirty-three.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Gad; Ziphion, and Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.
verses.ct: Gad's sons were Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Asher; Jimnah, and Ishuah, and Isui, and Beriah, and Serah their sister: and the sons of Beriah; Heber, and Malchiel.
verses.ct: Asher's sons were Jimnah, Ishuah, Isui, and Beriah, and their sister was Serah. Beriah's sons were Heber and Malchiel.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter, and these she bare unto Jacob, even sixteen souls.
verses.ct: These were the descendants of Zilpah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Leah. She bore these children to Jacob—sixteen souls in all.

verses.kjv: The sons of Rachel Jacob’s wife; Joseph, and Benjamin.
verses.ct: The sons of Jacob's wife Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, which Asenath the daughter of Potipherah priest of On bare unto him.
verses.ct: In Egypt, Manasseh and Ephraim were born to Joseph. Their mother was Asenath, the daughter of Potipherah, priest of On.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Benjamin were Belah, and Becher, and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard.
verses.ct: Benjamin's sons were Belah, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Rachel, which were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.
verses.ct: These were Rachel's descendants who were born to Jacob—fourteen souls in all.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Dan; Hushim.
verses.ct: Dan's son was Hushim.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Naphtali; Jahzeel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shillem.
verses.ct: Naphtali's sons were Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Bilhah, which Laban gave unto Rachel his daughter, and she bare these unto Jacob: all the souls were seven.
verses.ct: These were the descendants of Bilhah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Rachel. She bore these children to Jacob—seven souls in all.

verses.kjv: All the souls that came with Jacob into Egypt, which came out of his loins, besides Jacob’s sons’ wives, all the souls were threescore and six;
verses.ct: The total number of Jacob's direct descendants who went to Egypt, not counting his sons' wives, was sixty-six souls.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Joseph, which were born him in Egypt, were two souls: all the souls of the house of Jacob, which came into Egypt, were threescore and ten.
verses.ct: Joseph's sons, who were born to him in Egypt, numbered two. Altogether, the souls of Jacob's household who came to Egypt totaled seventy.

verses.kjv: And he sent Judah before him unto Joseph, to direct his face unto Goshen; and they came into the land of Goshen.
verses.ct: Jacob sent Judah ahead to Joseph so he could get directions to Goshen. When they arrived, they settled in the region of Goshen.

verses.kjv: And Joseph made ready his chariot, and went up to meet Israel his father, to Goshen, and presented himself unto him; and he fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while.
verses.ct: Joseph prepared his chariot and traveled to Goshen to meet his father Israel. When he appeared before him, he threw his arms around his father's neck and wept there for a long time.

verses.kjv: And Israel said unto Joseph, Now let me die, since I have seen thy face, because thou art yet alive.
verses.ct: Israel told Joseph, "Now I can die in peace, because I have seen your face and know that you are still alive."

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, and unto his father’s house, I will go up, and shew Pharaoh, and say unto him, My brethren, and my father’s house, which were in the land of Canaan, are come unto me;
verses.ct: Joseph said to his brothers and his father's household, "I will go to Pharaoh and inform him, 'My brothers and my father's household, who were living in Canaan, have come to me.

verses.kjv: And the men are shepherds, for their trade hath been to feed cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.
verses.ct: These men are shepherds who have spent their lives raising livestock. They have brought along their flocks, their herds, and everything they own.'

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you, and shall say, What is your occupation?
verses.ct: "When Pharaoh summons you and asks, 'What do you do for a living?'

verses.kjv: That ye shall say, Thy servants’ trade hath been about cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the Egyptians.
verses.ct: you should answer, 'Your servants have been raising livestock since we were young, just as our fathers did before us.' This way you will be allowed to settle in Goshen, since the Egyptians despise shepherds."
